chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: The next thing we are going to study in Forms is called Dropdowns.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: We have seen many dropdowns in Forms.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: In HTML, we create dropdowns in the form of select.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: If I search for select MDN, then we must have seen many such things.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Sometimes we have to fill in the information of our state or city in the form.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, we usually see this type of form element.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, these are called dropdowns and we create them in Forms using our select element.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: How is it created?

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: I create a select element with the tag select.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Now, I can define my name in the select tag.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: The information that will be selected in the dropdown, will be submitted to the URL.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, we will put that name and ID.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And then we define different options.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I have to write an option tag for each individual in my dropdown.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: For example, if I want to create a dropdown where I am asking about my profession,

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: I have to give two options in my dropdown.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: One option is that I am a student and the other is that I am a developer.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I have to create two options for that.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: I will use the option tag.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And the value that we define in the option tag, will be passed in the backend.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: What we are going to do is, we will write the same code and run it once.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And then we will analyze it.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I will go to the HTML document and create another div.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Where I will write, choose your profession.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Now, I am going to create a dropdown from the select.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: The name of this dropdown will be the name attribute, profession.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And its ID is also going to be equal to the profession.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Now, I am going to refresh the page.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: I can see the same text, choose your profession.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And I have just created a dropdown.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, it is not much to click on it.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: But I can see an arrow that is pointing downwards.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Usually, this is the symbol of a dropdown.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Now, I am going to create multiple options.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Let's create the first option.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: In which, the value will be passed as my student.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, this is the student's option.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: The second option that we can put is the developer's option.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I can simply write dev here.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Let's save and refresh.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Now, I can select multiple options from the dropdown.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And as soon as I select the developer and submit it.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: What is in my URL?

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: The information is in the URL, profession is equal to dev.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And as soon as I submit the student,

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: my profession is now in the form of student.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, the information that is passed is not the text.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: After submitting in the URL, the information that is passed in the data,

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: the value that is passed is not the developer.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: But the text that I have written in the value attribute.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: This information is passed if I select the developer.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, this is how we create dropdowns in HTML.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: In some cases, we can create an empty option.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: I mean, if I write an option here that has no value.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I can write here, select your option.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Let's save it.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And go back and refresh.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, in this way, select your option will come.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: In which, I will have two options, student and developer.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And this select your option usually comes default.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Now, if I want to have the student selected before.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I can write selected in the option.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: Let's save and refresh.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, the student will be selected before.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: After that, I can select the developer.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: But if I want to have the developer selected before.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, I can write selected in the dev.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And the developer will be pre-selected.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: So, whenever we have to pre-select the options,

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: we can use the selected attribute.

chunks.title: Select - Input Element
chunks.text: And in this way, we will be using the dropdowns in the HTML forms.

text: The next thing we are going to study in Forms is called Dropdowns. We have seen many dropdowns in Forms. In HTML, we create dropdowns in the form of select. If I search for select MDN, then we must have seen many such things. Sometimes we have to fill in the information of our state or city in the form. So, we usually see this type of form element. So, these are called dropdowns and we create them in Forms using our select element. How is it created? I create a select element with the tag select. Now, I can define my name in the select tag. The information that will be selected in the dropdown, will be submitted to the URL. So, we will put that name and ID. And then we define different options. So, I have to write an option tag for each individual in my dropdown. For example, if I want to create a dropdown where I am asking about my profession, I have to give two options in my dropdown. One option is that I am a student and the other is that I am a developer. So, I have to create two options for that. I will use the option tag. And the value that we define in the option tag, will be passed in the backend. What we are going to do is, we will write the same code and run it once. And then we will analyze it. So, I will go to the HTML document and create another div. Where I will write, choose your profession. Now, I am going to create a dropdown from the select. The name of this dropdown will be the name attribute, profession. And its ID is also going to be equal to the profession. Now, I am going to refresh the page. I can see the same text, choose your profession. And I have just created a dropdown. So, it is not much to click on it. But I can see an arrow that is pointing downwards. Usually, this is the symbol of a dropdown. Now, I am going to create multiple options. Let's create the first option. In which, the value will be passed as my student. So, this is the student's option. The second option that we can put is the developer's option. So, I can simply write dev here. Let's save and refresh. Now, I can select multiple options from the dropdown. And as soon as I select the developer and submit it. What is in my URL? The information is in the URL, profession is equal to dev. And as soon as I submit the student, my profession is now in the form of student. So, the information that is passed is not the text. After submitting in the URL, the information that is passed in the data, the value that is passed is not the developer. But the text that I have written in the value attribute. This information is passed if I select the developer. So, this is how we create dropdowns in HTML. In some cases, we can create an empty option. I mean, if I write an option here that has no value. So, I can write here, select your option. Let's save it. And go back and refresh. So, in this way, select your option will come. In which, I will have two options, student and developer. And this select your option usually comes default. Now, if I want to have the student selected before. So, I can write selected in the option. Let's save and refresh. So, the student will be selected before. After that, I can select the developer. But if I want to have the developer selected before. So, I can write selected in the dev. And the developer will be pre-selected. So, whenever we have to pre-select the options, we can use the selected attribute. And in this way, we will be using the dropdowns in the HTML forms.
